intro: Reseda undata subsp. leucantha, commonly known as white lady's mantle, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its foliage remains evergreen throughout the year, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. It is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
